document.ModsDocTitle: A new genus of Coelotinae (Araneae, Agelenidae) from southern China
document.docAuthor: Chen, Lu, Li, Shuqiang & Zhao, Zhe
document.docTitle: Flexicoelotes jiaohanyanensis Chen & Li, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: A new genus of Coelotinae (Araneae, Agelenidae) from southern China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new genus of Coelotinae (Araneae, Agelenidae) from southern China

subSubSection.paragraph: Flexicoelotes jiaohanyanensis Chen & Li sp. n. Figs 2, 3, 9

Holotype ♂: China: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region: Baise City: Jingxi County, Equan Village, Jiaohanyan Cave, N23°06'22" , E106°24'02" , elevation: 697 m, 23.XII.2012, Z.G. Chen and Z. Zhao leg. Paratypes: 3♀3♂, same data as holotype.
The specific name is derived from the type locality; adjective.

caption.paragraph: Figure 2. Flexicoelotes jiaohanyanensis sp. n., holotype male. A Left palp, prolateral view B Left palp, ventral view C Left palp, retrolateral view. Scale bar: equal for A, B, C.

Figure 3. Flexicoelotes jiaohanyanensis sp. n., one of paratype females. A Epigyne, ventral view B Vulva, dorsal view C Male habitus, dorsal view D Female habitus, dorsal view E Female habitus, ventral view. Scale bars: equal for A, B; equal for D, E.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male (holotype): Total length 6.58. Carapace 3.88 long, 2.70 wide. Abdomen 3.24 long, 2.15 wide. Eye sizes and interdistances: AME 0.13, ALE 0.18, PME 0.17, P LE 0.18; AME-AME 0.04, AME-ALE 0.03, PME-PME 0.08, PME-PLE 0.07. Leg measurements: I: 15.16 (3.85, 5.10, 3.91, 2.30); II: 14.07 (3.72, 4.35, 3.76, 2.24); III: 13.13 (3.64, 3.95, 3.63, 1.91); IV: 17.05 (4.00, 5.26, 5.45, 2.34). Palp: patellar apophysis long, subequal to half of patellar width; RTA with pointed tip, extending beyond distal margin of tibia; LTA short, approximately less than 1/5 length of RTA; cymbial furrow short, about 1/4 length of cymbium; conductor broad, apex bent, with blunt tip; dorsal conductor apophysis small; median apophysis small, spoon-like; anterior apophysis broad, with blunt tip; embolus filiform, beginning at 6:30 to 7 o'clock position (Fig. 2 A-C ).
Known only from the type locality (Fig. 9).
